medium: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash over black chalk on brown laid paper, with later touches of white heightening
creditline: Gift of Miss Margaret Mower for the Elsa Durand Mower Collection
inscribed: Pen and brown ink, lower right: Parmesan

texts.textentryhtml:
See files for note by A. E. Popham, written September 12, 1962, to somebody (name obliterated) at Spink’s, London: “It still puzzles me but I suppose it must be Parmigianino.  It was etched by Hollar and was presumably therefore in the Arundel collection.”;

From Popham, “Catalogue of the Drawings of Parmigianino”: Probably dates from Bolognese period, 1527-31.  Would appear to have been the pendant to a lost drawing also etched by Hollar” (reproduced on pl. 288). (See reference Bib. 4620);

From Gnann, “Parmigianino…:” dates drawing ca. 1526. (See reference Bib. 4621);

bibliography.boilertext: A. E. Popham, Catalogue of the drawings of Parmigianino, (New Haven, CT: Published for the Pierpont Morgan Library [by] Yale University Press, 1971).
bibliography.citation:
A. E. Popham, Catalogue of the drawings of Parmigianino, (New Haven, CT: Published for the Pierpont Morgan Library [by] Yale University Press, 1971).

, Vol. 1: p. 229, no. 801; Vol. 2: pl. 288

bibliography.boilertext: Achim Gnann, Parmigianino: die Zeichnungen, (Petersberg: M. Imhof, 2007).
bibliography.citation: Achim Gnann, Parmigianino: die Zeichnungen, (Petersberg: M. Imhof, 2007)., Vol. 1: p. 153, 434, no. 530; Vol. 2: p. 439 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).

caption: Parmigianino (Italian, 1503–1540), Young Woman Carrying a Vessel, late 1530s. Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash over black chalk on brown laid paper, with later touches of white heightening; 23 × 11.7 cm, 40 × 32.4 × 3.2 cm (frame). Gift of Miss Margaret Mower for the Elsa Durand Mower Collection (x1962-65)
